docs.snippet: President Vladimir Putin said on Monday that Russia's government should "carefully" use its "rainy day" reserve funds now when low oil and other commodity prices have dented budget revenues....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Vladimir Putin said on Monday that Russia's government should "carefully" use its "rainy day" reserve funds now when low oil and other commodity prices have dented budget revenues.

headline.main: Putin Tells Government to Use Its Rainy-Day Funds 'Carefully'
headline.print_headline: Putin Tells Government to Use Its Rainy-Day Funds 'Carefully'

docs.snippet: Russia is interested in resuming in full its relations with Egypt in tourism and in civil aviation flights, Russian news agencies quoted Sergei Naryshkin, the speaker of the Russian lower house of parliament, as saying on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russia is interested in resuming in full its relations with Egypt in tourism and in civil aviation flights, Russian news agencies quoted Sergei Naryshkin, the speaker of the Russian lower house of parliament, as saying on Monday.

headline.main: Top Russian MP Eyes Resumption of Flights, Tourism With Egypt: Agencies
headline.print_headline: Top Russian MP Eyes Resumption of Flights, Tourism With Egypt: Agencies

docs.snippet: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday criticized Soviet founder Vladimir Lenin, accusing him of placing a "time bomb" under the state, and sharply denouncing brutal repressions by the Bolshevik government....

docs.snippet: Lowering expectations about his ability to help end Syria's civil war, the U.N. special envoy announced talks between government and opposition representatives will start on Friday to embark on a six-month process that he hopes will include civil ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Lowering expectations about his ability to help end Syria's civil war, the U.N. special envoy announced talks between government and opposition representatives will start on Friday to embark on a six-month process that he hopes will include civil society and women's groups.

headline.main: UN Envoy Lowers Expectations Ahead of Syria Talks on Friday
headline.print_headline: UN Envoy Lowers Expectations Ahead of Syria Talks on Friday

docs.snippet: U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry on Monday dismissed Syrian government claims and opposition complaints as posturing ahead of U.N.-led peace talks that are to begin Friday and last six months....

docs.snippet: Russia's economy shrank 3.7 percent in 2015, the worst drop since the depths of the global financial crisis, as the country struggled with a drop in the price of its oil exports and international sanctions, the state statistics service said Monday...
docs.lead_paragraph: Russia's economy shrank 3.7 percent in 2015, the worst drop since the depths of the global financial crisis, as the country struggled with a drop in the price of its oil exports and international sanctions, the state statistics service said Monday.

headline.main: Russian Economy Has Worst Year Since Global Financial Crisis
headline.print_headline: Russian Economy Has Worst Year Since Global Financial Crisis
